## Introduction

JSON API for BuddyPress is a plugin, that supports the [JSON API Plugin](http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/json-api/) with a new Controller to get information from BuddyPress.

## Requirements

Requirements are a working [WordPress](http://wordpress.org/) installation with [BuddyPress](http://buddypress.org/) installed. Furthermore the plugin JSON API needs to be installed and configured, please refer to its installation manual (http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/json-api/installation/)

To install JSON API for BuddyPress follow the [installation manual](https://github.com/tweichart/JSON-API-for-BuddyPress/wiki/Installation-manual), for the right usage take a look at the [usage](https://github.com/tweichart/JSON-API-for-BuddyPress/wiki/Usage)page.

For future features refer to the [Release Management Plan](https://github.com/tweichart/JSON-API-for-BuddyPress/wiki/Release-Management-Plan).

## Installation

To install JSON API for BuddyPress just follow these steps:
* upload the folder "json-api-for-buddypress" to your WordPress plugin folder (<url-to-wordpress>/wp-content/plugins)
* activate the plugin through the 'Plugins' menu in WordPress or by using the link provided by the plugin installer
* activate the controller through the JSON API menu found in the WordPress admin center (Settings -> JSON API)

## Updates, Support and Contact
For updates just star this project. Furthermore some new updates or informations may be found on my [Twitter-Account](https://twitter.com/tweichart).
As the author of this I plugin I do give you support, whilst it may njot be immediately sometimes. Just open an issue, tweet or mail me.
